nodes.text: Sunberry pie was a pie made of sunberries that the Ewok Shodu Warrick was known to make at a high quality. In 3 ABY, she made some sunberry pie for a festival in Bright Tree Village on the Forest Moon of Endor. After the festival was over, Shodu's son, Wicket Warrick, pretended that the crying of a group of woklings was due to their wishing for more sunberry pie instead of the real reason—they were frightened after visiting Horville's Hut of Horrors.
Sunberry pie was a type of pie made from sunberries that was beige in color, circular, and edible by Ewoks.

In 3 ABY, at an Ewok festival in Bright Tree Village on the Forest Moon of Endor, the young Ewoks Wicket Wystri Warrick and Kneesaa a Jari Kintaka delivered a basket of sunberry fruits to Warrick's mother, Shodu Warrick. Shodu used the berries for her pies, which she made for the festival. Shodu thanked them, saying that she could always use more berries at carnival time. Kintaka praised her pies and noted that they always received first prize. Shodu then asked Wicket and Kintaka to watch over Wicket's wokling sister, Winda, while she was busy preparing her pies.

Later that day, Wicket and Winda returned home with several of Wicket's friends and other woklings after visiting the Horville's Hut of Horrors attraction, which scared all of the woklings. As they cried from the fright, the adult Ewoks arrived, and Shodu inquired what was going on. Wicket tried to hide the woklings' true reason for crying, as he was not supposed to have taken them to the Hut of Horrors; he claimed that they were having a sleepover and that the woklings were simply crying for more of Shodu's sunberry pie. As though to prove his point, he and his friends shoved slices of it in the mouths of the woklings. Two of the adult Ewoks, Weechee and Widdle Warrick, also tried to take slices of the pie, though Shodu took away the pie before Willy could eat any.

Sunberry pie appeared in "Horville's Hut of Horrors," the sixteenth episode in the second season of the animated television series Ewoks, which was written by Paul Dini and premiered on November 15, 1986.
